benchmark_details.name: B2NERD (Beyond-Boundary Named Entity Recognition Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: B2NERD is a compact dataset designed to guide large language models' generalization in Open Named Entity Recognition under a universal entity taxonomy, refined from 54 existing datasets.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance LLMs for Open NER by directly addressing inconsistencies and redundancies in existing training datasets.

data.source: Refined from 54 existing English and Chinese datasets.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts including conflict detection and standardization.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on strict span-based micro-F1.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance at recognizing entities.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared against GPT-4, B2NER models showed an improvement of 6.8-12.0 points in F1 on various benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures include cross-dataset entity validation experiments to identify inconsistencies.
